perturbation.original_text: In the event that UBS AG provides the information referred to above, such information shall be provided not later than five (5) business days prior to the date in which the Master Servicer is required to file a Form 10-D for such Distribution Date.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event that UBS AG provides the information referred to above, such information shall be provided no later than two (2) business days prior to the date on which the Master Servicer is required to file a Form 10-D for such Distribution Date.
perturbation.explanation: Regulation AB mandates timely disclosure of financial information. Reducing the timeframe to two business days may not provide sufficient time for the Master Servicer to adequately review and incorporate the information into the Form 10-D, potentially leading to non-compliance with SEC filing requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Regulation AB under the Securities Act of 1933 and the Securities Exchange Act of 1934

perturbation.original_text: If a Ratings Event occurs with respect to UBS AG, then UBS AG shall, at       its own expense, (i) assign this Transaction hereunder to a third party       within thirty (30) days of such Ratings Event that meets or exceeds, or as       to which any applicable credit support provider meets or exceeds, the       Approved Rating Threshold (as defined below) on terms substantially       similar to this Confirmation or (ii) deliver collateral acceptable in a       form and amount acceptable to Fitch Ratings ("Fitch") and Moody's       Investors Service Inc. ("Moody's) within thirty (30) days of such Ratings       Event and subject to written confirmation from Fitch and Moody's that       delivery of such collateral in the context of such downgrade will not       result in a withdrawal, qualification or downgrade of the then current       ratings assigned to the Certificates.
perturbation.changed_text: If a Ratings Event occurs with respect to UBS AG, then UBS AG shall, at its own expense, (i) assign this Transaction hereunder to a third party within fifteen (15) days of such Ratings Event that meets or exceeds, or as to which any applicable credit support provider meets or exceeds, the Approved Rating Threshold (as defined below) on terms substantially similar to this Confirmation or (ii) deliver collateral acceptable in a form and amount acceptable to Fitch Ratings ("Fitch") and Moody's Investors Service Inc. ("Moody's) within fifteen (15) days of such Ratings Event and subject to written confirmation from Fitch and Moody's that delivery of such collateral in the context of such downgrade will not result in a withdrawal, qualification or downgrade of the then current ratings assigned to the Certificates.
perturbation.explanation: Decreasing the timeframe for UBS AG to address a Ratings Event from 30 to 15 days may be insufficient under market conditions, potentially leading to a default under the agreement and negatively impacting the certificate holders. This could be viewed as an unreasonable constraint conflicting with standards requiring adequate time for remediation of financial issues.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring reasonableness in contractual terms, and potentially securities regulations relating to fair and adequate risk management.
perturbation.location: Additional Termination Events: Rating Agency Downgrade:

perturbation.original_text: Swap Disclosure Event. If upon the occurrence of a Swap Disclosure Event (as defined in paragraph (xxiii) above), UBS AG has not, within 5 business days after such Swap Disclosure Event complied with any of the provisions set forth in paragraph (xxiii) above, then an Additional Termination Event shall have occurred with respect to UBS AG with UBS AG as the sole Affected Party with respect to such Additional Termination Event.
perturbation.changed_text: Swap Disclosure Event. If upon the occurrence of a Swap Disclosure Event (as defined in paragraph (xxiii) above), UBS AG has not, within 1 business day after such Swap Disclosure Event complied with any of the provisions set forth in paragraph (xxiii) above, then an Additional Termination Event shall have occurred with respect to UBS AG with UBS AG as the sole Affected Party with respect to such Additional Termination Event.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the compliance timeframe for a Swap Disclosure Event to one business day is highly impractical and likely impossible. This timeframe does not afford UBS AG adequate time to gather and provide necessary disclosures, secure a replacement entity, or obtain a suitable guaranty. This unrealistically short deadline could trigger an Additional Termination Event unfairly, conflicting with principles of good faith and commercial reasonableness.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring good faith and commercial reasonableness, and Regulation AB requirements for adequate time to disclose financial information.
perturbation.location: Additional Termination Events: Swap Disclosure Event.
